page.title: 06UNITED BISCUITS HARLESDEN
page.content: {United Biscuits Harlesden}was built in 1902.The Harlesden factory employs 1303 people. Each employee averages 40 hours per week.The day is split into two shifts :{0800-1700 and 1330-2130. Jobs in the factory vary from the lightest (taking care of machines) to the heaviest (stacking boxes).The heaviest work is normally done by middle aged men. The firm's most popular product is {Jaffa Cakes.}These are exported to Belgium, France and Canada. United Biscuits is the third largest biscuit firm in Great Britain and the second largest in the U.S.A. When interviewed,the workers felt satisfied with their wages but most of them agreed that conveyor belts were a threat to their jobs.
